reviewText:
The planet has been overrun by brain slurping neon pink aliens. Meet Jerry, a straightforward guy ready to save the day and possibly the world with nothing more then his flashlights and wits.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mds1Oy2tvd0
It came from space is a no nonsense twin-stick shooter, with beautiful subtle colours and electro soundtrack the games aesthetics really do stand out. You have the ability the select from 6 different zones and play in singleplayer or co-op modes supporting up to 4 players. KB+mouse and gamepad controls were both responsive, though I preferred mouse as you could direct the crosshair more accurately which seemed to increase weapon damage or critical shots.

Sticking to the tried and tested formula of 'survival waves', rounds will quickly speed up the numbers of enemies and types of species spawned while giving you a short rest between each. Killing enemies and getting higher combos results in larger drops of money which are used for upgrading the 1 of 6 weapons, pistol, shotgun, machine gun, plasma gun, laser gun and the old faithful rocket launcher. While you can sit in a corner and gather enemies up, running around the levels uncovers random drops of temporary weapon upgrades, health packs and cash so it's worth staying on the move.

Difficulty options were easy, medium, hard or insane and while I did not have a chance to try multiplayer yet, I'm sure it would increase spawns per person connected adding to the challenge. Both local and online high score boards were also available for each level. Would like to see new zones added in future but whats there is enough to enjoy and recommend. Quite similar to some of puppygames products like Ultratron, if they were set in a 3d world. (good thing!). Cheers. :)

reviewText:
A tense action game where the objective is to herd and shoot down hundreds of aliens.

Crowd control and spatial awareness is important, so in sense it plays a bit like a top-down Serious Sam game as you often find yourself running backwards and shooting at a big flock of monsters that all want you dead.
In co-op mode, teamwork and positioning is important as to not let the aliens get spread out across the whole map, which results in chaos and tight situations. Caches with gold (spent on guns and upgrades), health and temporary power-ups drop at various places on the map, which adds another layer of risk and strategy.

Most of the maps are fairly dark, apart from a few lamps, the only light sources are your torch and the aliens' glowing faces, so getting to know the maps is an important step in mastering the game. I like this art-style, however the lack of a brightness setting can be disappointing for some players with old or worn out monitors.

All in short, quite enjoyable and would certainly recommend it to anyone looking for an action packed, yet tactical game with lots of enemies to shoot.

reviewText:
I'm conflicted over this game. On the one hand, it has a very charming presentation. On the other, there are so many design choices (flaws) that I cannot agree with for this type of game.

You play as a survivor of an alien attack that's instantly thrown into waves of attacks in a dark, minimalistic backdrop. The enemies are wonderfully designed (kind of like grues) while the character model and animations for him are noticeably subpar. In the screenshots you can see that multiplayer doesn't even give you different colored costumes. There is some clipping in the game for your hands/guns and the hitbox for guns/solid objects is buggy. You can shoot any car/wall/house and your bullets stop, but if you have a shotgun they may as well not be there. Same damage radius blocked or unblocked which reduces an element of skill for it. It's not the biggest thing but it's there and feels like something they should have fixed by full release.

The game's scoring system is entirely based around how many aliens you can chain kill. To do this you have to wait for them all to converge on your location from all over the map per wave and kite them as one big group. The money you get is always the same per kill, but you get multiplier bonuses for the alien kill scoreboard. This system is very unrewarding though and there's really only one way to do it - slow, systematic chore working. There is no variance and each time you play a level it's exactly the same as the previous time.

On the difficulty levels, you have easy all the way up to insane. Easy slows enemies down and gives them less HP, while insane adds more aliens with higher HP and speeds them up. But this turns out to be more artificial than anything. The way they scale them is that the most versatile/mobile enemies will have more HP to take down while the should-be-tankier fodder actually has less. So you spend more time trying to kill the hard to hit ones even though their evasion scales enough on its own. This type of balancing system makes no sense. The biggest and baddest enemies are also the slowest, which means you'll never get hit by them.

The weapons aren't very balanced either. Anything fully upgraded is efficient to use. This means that the ones that cost more are useless since they take too long to get when you actually need them. You only have 1 weapon slot anyway and you'll always take a one weapon upgrade path.

I would have seen this game as great potential for a co-op horde horror arcade game. Especially if it had procedurally generated levels and they fixed the balance issues. Something like using the lights and darkness to make them slower/faster would have been an amazing dynamic. As it is now though, I'm surprised it's still not in early access. The design choices make no sense for this type of game.

It's very cute, but has completely unrewarding gameplay. This surprises me because this genre isn't complicated at all. Even games like Titan Attacks are just clones with added charm and that would have been enough here. I don't recommend this game. It seems like it should be in early access still and could use a thoughtful overhaul.

I'm making this a review rather than a discussion because I really don't think one random person saying redo everything" is something they'd take into serious consideration and I'm supposed to be curating this for them. :P I'll still add it to that list as agreed upon but I can't fake a positive for it. Buy at your own risk until they change it. Play Nation Red while you wait for that."

I got my hands on ICFSAAOB (Damn that long name!) shortly after the release, we've also done a multiplayer review in form of a video with the best bits of our gameplay that you can watch below and have a TLDR version.

ICFSAAOB is an arcade topdown shooter, thus all I expect really is fun. Replayability. Some decent variety of content, guns, gamemodes maybe. I'll talk about all the aspects of the game though. Let me start with one of the best things.

Graphics, stylization. The way this game is made on the visual side of things is great. The colors are well balanced, there's perfect contrast, weapons have diverse designs and the projectiles vibrant awesome different colours. If anything, this game is a pretty thing to look at! It's like looking at slot machines, you just can't turn your head off of it.

Hand in hand with graphics comes sound design. The sound effects are really good as well, everything sounds awesome (nope, not a LEGO reference) and even the gnarling horde of aliens is believable. Both your eyes and ears will get stimuled by these things and by the end of the playthrough you will surelly have problems realizing if what you see and what you hear is the real world. I had pink goo coming out of my ears.

Fun factor is definitely high and we had a lot of laughs playing this in two, and I can bet it would be even more fun playing in four people. The increasing difficulty of the game with changing levels is keeping everyone awake and a bunch of funny achievements only make it better.

Where the game falls short right now is content-wise. The weapon store and upgrade system is very bland, predictable and it's missing that “MOM I NEED THAT” factor. Same goes for replayability, it just doesn't get anywhere else after a while and I'd much welcome an addition of different gamemodes, or even the possibility of new strategies. There's been a mention of turrets on the forums, oh hell yeah! Give me turrets and a base I have to defend against these pink f*ckers and I'll fire this game any time! That applies to level design which is bland after a while, it just need that spark, maybe a little interactivity, but definitely a change.

Dont let that fool you, this game is great and has great potential. It just need that little kick in the back to make it awesome. And given the nature of the developer we can surely expect this kick. Promised weekly updates, feature-wishlist on the forums, etc. seems like he cares and to me that's one of the things that matter the most in a game. If a developer releases a game and shortly after abandons it, then why should I care as well?

On the technical side of things, it was very easy to set up a multiplayer game so I have to give a thumbs up for that, as it's still (even in the 21st century) not easy in every game. There were acceptable lag issues (US - EU multiplayer), so yeah nothing wrong.



And that's about it for the textual review, as I feel I covered the main points and I don't want to makle this too huge. For a price of 10$ (which is absolutely fair pricing) you get a pretty good looking indie game, with some cool content and adrenaline gameplay, get it, go spam that wishlist thread and be a part of this game becoming AWESOME, you won't regret.

If you're interested in multiplayer gameplay and a conjoined opinion from two people (a guy who makes reviews for indiegamebundles.com and a graphic designer) definitely watch this video:

https://youtu.be/7UVkrbjf9JY

Otherwise, thanks for reading this review, I hope it helped you out with your decisioning.

reviewText:
This game is absolutely amazing. It incorporates such simple dynamics and just makes them fresh and fun as all hell. It's literally just a giant, pink, glowing, alien shooting, rage fest. And a damn good one too.

Gameplay: One moment you will be strolling around looking for upgrades dropped by that weird VTOL type Police thing, and the next you will be running as fast as you ♥♥♥♥ing can right back where you came from shooting the ♥♥♥♥ out of hordes and hordes and aliens with your upgraded plasma gun. So yeah, gameplay wise, this game is the ♥♥♥♥. The only complaint I have is that on Countryside, things get way too crammed and it kinda ruins that run and gun experience, but every other map is pretty damn solid.

Sound: The sound design is pretty good. The creepy, glitchy, alien music sets the intense yet stylish mood right from the get-go. The aliens make these weird sounds all unique to each type, which makes it all the more awesome yet terrifying when you hear certain ones coming your way.

Weapons: The weapons are awesome. Hands down great. They each have their own unique style of gameplay and make for a unique experience each time. The pistol seems to be the only weapon which just isn't worth investing your hard earned cash in, but oh well. Each weapon can be upgraded 3 times, and they all have different prices based on I suppose the develepors view of their awesomeness and worth (which means the rocket launcher is obviously gonna be the most expensive, even though I prefer the plasma gun myself). I wish they would add some more weapons, and maybe change their designs which are pretty bland at the moment, but otherwise they are top notch.

Maps: Before I did complain about one map, Countryside which just really seems to be too squished compared to the other maps I've played so far, but that's about all of the negatives for the maps. They are relatively well spaced out, and while they are challenging enough to manuever around, they are also fair and give you chances to escape the alien horde at almost every turn, albeit only just alive that is.

Other: With developers that constantly change and add things to the game, this game will always feel new and fresh every time you come back to play it. I haven't really played much multiplayer at the moment, so I can't really give my view on that, but one thing I feel the developers absolutely NEED to add is some customization. The guy you control is really really bland, and it almost ruins the quirky side of the atmosphere. I'd just love to see some customization of my character and give him some of my own little traits. Other than that, that is all I can really think of.

Summary:
Positives:
-Great pace
-Intense gameplay
-Quirky style while also maintaining atmosphere
-Creepy yet silly sound design
-Nice array of weapons
-Constant updates

Negatives:
-Lack of character customisation (lol not even a negative tbh)
-Some map designs are a bit off (*cough* countryside)

Overall, I give it a 9.5/10. Basically just a quick game to play every now and then and have a blast while doing so. :)

I wouldn’t say this game is perfect or amazing, but it's definitely fun.

I got pwned pretty hard upon first launching the game in medium playing solo.  Easy wasn’t much better.  The game is more fun if you play with others.  Jumping onto multiplayer you should be able to find open games, and this is a lot of fun.

The game also has a good split screen local co-op mode.  This is also a lot of fun.

Basically you need multiple people to play so that you can die.  As long as your mate survives for 20 seconds you can respawn.

Pros
Good aesthetic design.  It’s the blocky “voxel” style but it looks good and clean.
Good combat and weapon variety.  The weapon upgrades are fun and keep me interested.
Good co-op gameplay
Cons
Levels are repetitive.  This is partly because the levels are all a dark “night” setting.
Gameplay isn’t that varied, but it’s still fun.
There is a bit of lag in online rounds when everyone is shooting upgraded weapons at a huge horde.  This is problematic since some aliens will jump at you.  I don’t know if this is because the other player’s internet connection was bad, or maybe the geographical distance was just too great.
Thoughts
Overall the game is fun and well made, yet simple.  For me, I probably will keep it installed for local co-op gaming with the Mrs’.  It seems like a game that would be fun to play with some background TV on.  A good party game.

reviewText:
A very simplistic yet entertaining game!
I featured this game on my Indie Sunday series. Check it out Here

After playing this game for a short while I have gathered what I believe to be enough information on this game to give it an honest review. Obviously games are selective in taste, so don't only read this review or watch my video, check out a few others before making a final decision to spend your money.

Postives
Graphics - Personally the simplicity of the graphics in this game are wonderful. I love the lighting effects and and how this game just looks alround.
Sound - The sound in this game is what you would expect it to be. You have the great atmospheric soundtrack whilst playing, the sound of each gun is different and noticeable, plus the abient sounds are also spot on.
Gameplay As I'm sure you have read or noticed already, this game is a roundbased survival game, and that is exactly what it is. You play as a man with guns shooting aliens that spawn. You are given 12 levels to pass, each one having to hit a certain milestone before being able to move on. You can upgrade your weapons whilst ingame. Very simplistic and very true to the nature of roundbased survival games. Also this game runs great, I'm sure you will not having any problem on any system.
Pick up and play - This game is great for those people looking for a game that they can load up and just play, you can have hours of fun just shooting things without having to worry about anything. Believe me, it is literally a pick up and play!

Negatives
Whilst I did struggle to find any true negatives for this game, I did look and found a few things to nickpick on, or better yet just one main thing
Multiplayer - I feel bad for mentioning this as the devs themselves cannot really do anything about this. Just with lack of players right now you will be VERY lucky to find anyone playing. In my time of playing I have only ever managed to come across one lobby. But as time goes on hopefully this game increases in popularity and multiplayer grows.

reviewText:
It seems like arena style shoot-em-ups are a dime a dozen. My earliest memories of arcades aren’t filled with Donkey Kong or Pacman. Instead, my weekly allowance was pumped into an arena-shooter called Smash TV. It’s a genre that started me on my path to video gaming glory long before my first Game Boy, and while my tastes now desire something more complex, there is a lot to be said for sitting back and shooting a mob of aliens in the face. ICFSAAOB offers a few new ideas, and the active nature of the dev team bodes extremely well for the future of the game. Weapons are a pleasure to use, and you always thirst for the next upgrade. The constant shadows do make the levels feel a bit too similar, but the dependence on your flashlight to spot the aliens is extremely engaging. Does it win out in the end? Let’s shed some light on It Came From Space And Ate Our Brains.

Whether you play with a friend or all alone, you are sure to encounter more aliens than you can handle. The difficulty of the game will determine the HP and speed of the alien horde. Combos are built by killing large strings of aliens in a row, if you want to maximize your weapon as fast as possible you need to let the aliens converge into a giant horde before splattering them to bits. It seems like a great plan on paper, but in execution this methodical method of maximizing wealth becomes quickly monotonous. The art style is extremely nice, and is determined to shine through the inky shadows that coat every stage. The terror of a mob of pink mouths marching through the dark is visceral. I’ve been telling people for years that pink is terrifying, now they will truly see.

The replayability of ICFSAAOB is largely thanks to the variety of weapons and upgrades. Lower cost weapons can be maxed out quicker, but will have less power in the long term. The weapon you end up picking should always compliment your style of play. Do you prefer to thin the horde with a rocket launcher? Or pick off the strays with a laser rifle? The choice is yours, and any pick you make will be the right one. There is a great sound to every weapon that can be noticed from the first “pop” of the default pistol. The music is a decent drum and bass track, but I feel like it is a bit too slow to really capture the frantic action that is happening on the screen especially when playing on Insane.

Overall, It Came From Space And Ate Our Brains is an extremely likeable game with an amazing aesthetic and decent gameplay. Skills are being added to the game slowly, and there is a wishlist thread over on the forums which informs me that Triangle Studios really are dedicated to making the best game possible. The game is extremely affordable at only $10. If you think you might enjoy kiting a horde while mowing them down with a chaingun, and having a friend with a plasma cannon watch your back, there is no excuse not to give this game a try. They try to improve the game and game balance based on the community feedback.

I started to play the game after a lot of talking about other games with the developers.

The game

You play the game with max 4 players, they got different fresh colors.
In a small map you get 6 waves of aliens. They are different from type.
You can upgrade your weapon with money, money drops from killed aliens.
also, you can buy items. This can be a sentry gun or a 15 sec power up.

reviewText:
The game is okay. You are basically playing a guy in third person and you have to defend yourself from an invasion of aliens. By killings aliens you earn money that you can use to buy or improve weapons or items. And that is all. No complicated plot or objectives.

Lets start with the positive points. Firstly you have a total of 6 different weapons to chose fromeach game. You start with the gun and with the money earned you can buy or upgrade the gun you want. You have the choice between the gun(starting weapon), shotgun, plasma, laser, machinegun and rocketlauncher. In addition you can also purchase items like turrents, shield, health. So depending how things are going or how you want to play you hav a decent amount of choice.

In addition to an obvious single player mode, you also have a multiplayer mode. You can play with friends or join a game with other people. I personnaly consider that the multiplayer mode is much more fun than the single play mode. Firstly because you can resurrect if there are still other players and also you have more strategies at your disposal.

There is a certain wariety in the type of aliens you encounter. I have seen around 8 different types i think. Depending on the type some guns are more effective than others. For example there is an alien that dodges your shots by teleporting sideways. This alien is difficult to kill with the normal pistol. Its however very easy to kill with a shotgun. Its interesting to see that different guns are effective against different ennemies and you can switch between guns depending on the situation.

Now lets continue with the negative/bad points. About the gameplay itself theoretically you have a varied choice of weapons to chose from (6 in total). However i consider that some are nearly always better choices than others. The rocket launcher for example is especially bad. You absolutely need a wall to explode the missiles. No wall no explosions or at least not where you want them. So depending on the map you can forget that weapon. I am always afraid to get upgrades lying on the floor because i am afraid to get a rocketlauncher which often ♥♥♥♥s me up.

Another problem is the environnement which sometime really ♥♥♥♥s you up. You can get stuck on small debris that has the same color as the ground so its hard to see. This happens a lot to me killing me very often. This is enhanced by the fact that the whole game is very dark. The only light you have is you torchlight. So debris that are hard to see become even harder to see. in addition to that environnement can influence the trajectory of your bullets. Ramps are one of the most annoying things. if you are on a ramp you can only shoot monsters on the ramp because youre shots go in the same direction as the ramp. If you are off the ramp the ramps absorb/block your shots. So when you are fighting you always have to watch out for the ramps otherwise you will be unable to hit certain ennemies.

The last problem is that there are not a lot of players in multiplayer mode. So you really need a friend that owns the game if you want to play in multiplayer mode.

reviewText:
What I like
Multiplayer. This game is so much more fun to play with a friend/friends then just playing it by yourself.
Nice graphics and sounds.
Very simple. Pick your gun/guns, collect upgrade boxes, blast aliens, and survive until the end.
Different difficulties.


What I didn't like
Repetitive. VERY VERY repetitive.
No need for more then just one gun. When you get to the harder difficulties it's better to stick with one gun and upgrade it all the way instead of getting more then one gun.
It gets kind of annoying just holding the shoot button down.
Easy is very boring.

Overall
This is a very fun game to play with a friend but not as much fun by yourself. Recommended if you have a friend to play with.
